intro: Eleocharis quinqueflora subsp. meridionalis, commonly known as the southern spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This species is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality.
